perturbation.original_text: N.   "Estimated Remaining Value" shall mean the number of calendar months remaining between the Effective Date of Termination and the last day of the Term, multiplied by the greater of (a) the Monthly Base Fee (as defined in Section 8.1 below) plus any other minimum monthly fee set forth in the Fee Schedule; and (b) the average monthly Fees payable by Customer during the three-month period prior to the event giving rise to termination rights under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: N.   "Estimated Remaining Value" shall mean an amount determined solely at M&I's discretion, considering factors such as market conditions and the difficulty of replacing Customer's business, with no fixed formula or relation to the Monthly Base Fee or average monthly Fees. M&I will provide a good faith estimate of the Estimated Remaining Value, but the final amount shall be determined by M&I.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Estimated Remaining Value' with a clear formula. The modified text introduces ambiguity by removing the formula and granting M&I sole discretion in determining the value, contradicting the original definition. This creates uncertainty and potential for disputes upon termination.

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 For Convenience.  Customer may terminate this Agreement during the Term upon at least one (1) years' written notice to M&I, provided that Customer pays M&I an early termination fee ("Termination for Convenience Fee") in an amount equal to REDACTED of the Estimated Remaining Value.  The Termination for Convenience Fee shall apply to any early termination of this Agreement other than pursuant to an Event of Default on the part of Customer or M&I or pursuant to Section 11.3 below.  Fifty percent of the Termination for Convenience Fee shall be paid to M&I within thirty (30) days following the date of Customer's notice and the remaining 50% shall be paid to M&I within thirty (30) days prior to the Effective Date of Termination.  In addition to the foregoing, Customer shall pay to M&I, any unamortized Conversion or other costs, reasonable Expenses in connection with the disposition of equipment, facilities and contracts related to M&I's performance of the Services on behalf of Customer.  The Termination for Convenience Fee shall not be subject to the limitations set forth in Section 13.4.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 For Convenience.  Customer may terminate this Agreement during the Term upon at least one (1) years' written notice to M&I. The payment of an early termination fee ("Termination for Convenience Fee") is optional and at the sole discretion of the Customer, but M&I may choose to deny the customer's termination if it is not paid. M&I also maintains the right to demand the customer compensate for Conversion or other costs, expenses, disposition of equipment and facilities; whether the termination fee is provided or not.  The Termination for Convenience Fee shall not be subject to the limitations set forth in Section 13.4.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Customer *must* pay a Termination for Convenience Fee to terminate the contract early. The modified text creates a contradiction by stating the payment of an early termination fee is *optional*. This introduces uncertainty regarding the Customer's obligations upon early termination and gives M&I an option of denial.

perturbation.original_text: 13.4 Limitation of Liability.  Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement, M&I's total liability under this Agreement shall not exceed payments made to M&I by Customer under this Agreement during the three (3) months prior to the event.  No lawsuit or other action may be brought by either party hereto, or on any claim or controversy based upon or arising in any way out of this Agreement be brought, after one (1) year from the date on which the cause of action arose; provided, however, the foregoing limitation shall not apply to the collection of any amounts due under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.4 Limitation of Liability.  Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement, M&I's total liability under this Agreement shall be unlimited, and M&I is responsible for all payments made to M&I by Customer under this agreement throughout the course of the agreement should a breach occur. No lawsuit or other action may be brought by either party hereto, or on any claim or controversy based upon or arising in any way out of this Agreement be brought, after ten (10) years from the date on which the cause of action arose; provided, however, the foregoing limitation shall not apply to the collection of any amounts due under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text creates a very specific limitation of liability for M&I. The modified version of the text contradicts the original statement by now removing the liability and extending the period of time for cause to be actioned.
